alert.note: Alert for Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 6:01PM MDT until August 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Saguache County in central Colorado... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Saguache. This includes the following streams and drainages... Studhorse Creek, Kerber Creek, Little Kerber Creek, Mill Creek, East Middle Creek, Ford Creek, Rio Grande Canal, Saguache Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Indian Creek, San Luis Creek, Brewery Creek, Garner Creek, Middle Creek, Findley Gulch, Flagstaff Creek, Jacks Creek, San Isabel Creek, Bear Creek and Alto Creek, Rito. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
